alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:26PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Isle of Wight, and southeastern York Counties, the City of Poquoson, the central City of Norfolk, the northwestern City of Portsmouth, the northeastern City of Suffolk, the City of Hampton and the central City of Newport News through 215 PM EDT... At 126 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Isle Of Wight, or near Windsor, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Hampton, Smithfield, Windsor, Langley AFB, Ocean View, Hampton University, Old Dominion University, Christopher Newport University, Patrick Henry Field, Churchland, Norfolk, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Northampton, Rescue, Tabb, Beaconsdale and Driver. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; York
